website_summaries.verdict: A value-priced, no-frills combo with a minimalist design. It also comes with some reliability issues that could interfere with its performance.
pros: Basic and easy to set up and start using
Keys have a nice feel under the fingers, and keyboard has a compact build that doesn't take up a lot of space
cons: Battery life is shorter than expected
Drops in connectivity are also common

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing and great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT industry for over ten years so I’ve used many keyboards mouse. I’ve used expensive mechanical keyboards, overpriced apple magic keyboard and other. But this $20 keyboard and mouse combination is awesome. See pictures for more. Pros Super easy to setup. One usb adaptor for both keyboard and mouse. 3 batteries in included with product. Elegant look. Protruding keys. Cons Material is good but can be better. But keep in mind you’re paying very little for both keyboard and mouse. So its worth. See pictures and decide yourself
customer_reviews.author: Manvendra Singh

customer_reviews.title: Keys stick and will lag - do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Design - Looks and feels great. Does not work. I build network systems and custom computers, so technically know about computers. After 2 months, the keyboard would lag and then type the same letter "llllllllllllllaaaaaaaaaaaagggggggggg" Attached USB dongle to a USB Extension and placed it 5" in front of the keyboard. Same issue. Updated the drivers from Dell website ( Windows 10 PRO 64 OS ), still does not work properly. I will be going back to logitech keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: MyAmazon Orders

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I am coder and make my living through keyboards. This one of the best I have used. It's range is 2-3' from under my desk. No issues. Battery life is normal. Very quiet and smooth key movements. While the keyboard is standard size, the keyboard is smaller than most and lower to the desk. I have spent far more on silly keyboards with extra features and buttons...they are typically noisy and larger. This one has a light for num-lock and caps-lock. That's all I need. Mouse is good too. The mouse-pad/surface makes all the difference. Nice click and smooth scroll wheel. (I have the v2 model)
customer_reviews.author: Barry K

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one after TSA destroyed the first one (owned for 2 years). Initially (when this keyboard used to cost 50% more), I was concerned about the value, but after a couple years and many other chiclet style keyboards purchased on the side, I can say it's totally worth it. The frame, the buttons, the functionality. All premium. The key feel is perfect. The buttons don't wobble at all and there's a very nice affirmative "give" once you reach the right pressure. The keys also seem to be coated to give a bit more grip as it's definitely an upgrade over some basic keys that can get slippery.
customer_reviews.author: dfukumot

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Dell KM636. I love it. The design and the feel of the keys are awesome. Very easy to type and it connected to my PC right away. I read some of the reviews and was a afraid that I might have some connection issues. Not at all. Connected right away. The little USB connection thing is connected to my CPU which is under the desk. The distance is not an issue at all.. I type really fast. I have not had one letter missed because of a lag. The mouse is so awesome and smooth too. Very happy. I like it so much, that I might buy one of these for my work. :)
customer_reviews.author: samdee

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.....
customer_reviews.text: I actually like the mouse and keyboard, worth a 4* rating, at least. What I DO NOT LIKE is the fact that they are rendered useless if you happen to misplace the tiny unifying USB dongle. Which I did. After a frustrating search for the replacement part, I gave up and entered into an online customer support chat with Dell, only to learn that they do not sell replacement dongles. So, my alternatives are to buy a new bundle or switch to a non-proprietary brand. Guess what choice I'm making. This makes no sense....unless the company has very different values from my own.
customer_reviews.author: BSpreng

customer_reviews.title: some of the key keep stuck
customer_reviews.text: I really like the style and how easy was to set up and also love the smoothness while typing, but the enter, letter D and some others key get stuck too often and its annoying to get them back up, this would be perfect to me if it didn't have this type of issues, I cant say that this is on every keyboard but maybe the one I have came defected. it has some source of gum inside that make it get stuck and its a lil bit hard to bring it back up as shown in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Soriano

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could rate it 0 Stars. On my 3rd one.
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say....when you first get it....your gonna love it...and then...keys are gonna stick and click and then your going to realize what a total POS this keyboard is. I liked it so much I kept trying. I'm done. Don't make the same mistake I did. I'm looking for a good easy touch keyboard w a CAPS light......feel free to make suggestions if you have em....thank you...
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard does not always register strokes and mouse stops working
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mouse and keyboard for approximately 3 months. The keyboard sometimes has a delay or does not register keystrokes. The mouse sporadically stops working after a few minutes. I have tried replacing the batteries 3 times. Extremely disappointed in the product. I have used Dell products frequently before and purchased this set because I have never had issues. This set has not lived up to my standards at all.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Beats the others...
customer_reviews.text: I recently tried some other wireless keyboard/mouse combos, but this one is the best I've found. Others had keys that would stick easily or had a mouse that was not immediately responsive. I returned them to Amazon. This Dell combo works smoothly. Plus, I like the keyboard "feel" and the convenient location of the master sound volume keys. Why four stars not five? I had the same model for several years, pounded it nonstop 24/7, and eventually a few key labels wore off and a couple of keys started sticking. So it won't last forever but it worked quite well for years.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Adams

customer_reviews.title: Always stays connected. No bluetooth problems (bc it's not!). Comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I've been exposed to many wireless keyboards and mice. I generally hate them all because they are either quirky regarding connectivity or some crazy design that is just hard to get used to. Example, I have a Logitech that you can't even type on--good luck typing in a password correctly in less than 5 tries. This is a simple design which makes it easy to use. The battery life is decent. Never any connectivity problems like bluetooth models seem to experience. The price is fantastic. I literally have 5 of these for use on various computers/equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Shockster

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Love the feel of the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Love the feel of the keyboard, keys are easy to find, just the right amount of resistance. Really like the sleek look - is a very appealing keyboard/mouse combo. I like that he mouse turns off without use (after several hours of non-use, only really happens when I go home for the day and is left unused for 8+ hours) - just a simple press of a button on the bottom get its up and going again. I don't have to manually turn it off nightly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S S.

customer_reviews.title: Key movement is great, but a lot bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This Dell keyboard is as great as others I have had. The keyboard is a bit bigger than i am used to, so hand placement and figure touch need some getttin used to (see the g I left off of getting). However, I love the separate navigation keys and keyboard - awesome. I also love either the wireless keyboard connectivity or the Bluetooth connectivity. I choose the wireless connectivity because I have too many other Bluetooth devices - otherwise, I would try it. For the price, a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard and mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: I needed a keyboard for my laptop and this thing is great! The mouse is extremely comfortable as well. The keys have a nice soft touch to them and no more clacking like a laptop keyboard. Setup was simple, pu tthe batteries in, plug in the transmitter and away we go. Shipping was fast also, originally was going to be here in 4 days and to my surprise it made it in my usual 2.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Reed

customer_reviews.title: indicators don't work and keyboard didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with this keyboard. It's probably just faulty but there are light indicators on the keyboard but they weren't functioning and when I plugged the dongle in, the mouse worked but nothing would type. There is nothing about this keyboard having indicator lights (though you can clearly see something there) and it's important to me to have an indicator light especially for numbers and caps lock so I didn't want to take another chance and have it replaced. I'm hoping the wired one has indicator lights. If not, that will go back too.
customer_reviews.author: RagdollMama

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Apple keyboards for years so I was a little scared of getting this one. I was not dissapointed! If you are looking for a keyboard with a number pad that is not as expensive as the apple one, get this one. It is quite, ergonomic, and so smooth to type on. The mouse on the other hand...is not my favorite. Too bad they dont sell the keyboard alone. I have a logitech mouse that I adore, however if you need a mouse the one here is decent. I highly recommend the keyboard though, you wont be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: KenIbel

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard great, mouse has issues
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, the keyboard is great, but i have had several issues with the mouse in less than 2 months of ownership and I am using my old Logitech until I can get a warranty replacement on the mouse. The scroll wheel works great in the down direction, but randomly jams and wont scroll up. Also the left click button has glitched several times where the mouse becomes unusable without turning off and back on. The mouse sells for $55 from Dell, so I would expect better quality from something at that price point.
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: very dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Thought this keyboard would make my life easier and my office neater. The keyboard was experiencing lag time between input and showing up on the screen. Not a computer processing issue, not a location or interference issue. I put up with it until most recently when the letter key "A" stopped working completely! I switched back to my wired keyboard with zero issue. Just learned that the return policy expires after 30 days and product support after 60 days, so I am stuck with this piece of junk now!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Kys stoppd working <---- guss whih ons?
customer_reviews.text: Nw: Two kys stoppd working... I an't vn typ this rviw without it bing omplt nonsns. Th ky that brok, as you an s is a ommon ky. Original: Excellent keyboard. The response of the keys is great and they jump back quickly. The spacing between keys is great for people who have bigger hands. No complaints whatsoever and for the price; it can't be beat. Side note: Remember to turn on the switch in the back of the keyboard; sounds obvious but it is a very small switch and can go unnoticed.
customer_reviews.author: audiogape

customer_reviews.title: Check the Version!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have mentioned, make sure you check the version you are buying. I purchased a V1 with the Logitech receiver but received a V2 with the Dell receiver. The V2 has a spotty connection at best and my wife hates it. Will be returning and hoping to receive the V1 in my next order. Dell failed on this attempt.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived partially broken
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard as my favorite library had this same design with the wiring, and wanted one for home use without the wires. Unfortunately the item arrived partially defective, as the battery did not close properly (one side just would not "click" all the way in, and I'm usually super delicate opening up new items). Not a big deal but for this price I don't really expect packages that seems to be thrown around the place. Too big of a hassle to return without a printer and not wanting to go outside during a pandemic, and the thing works with a duct tape piece attached not visible on the bottom and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Keyboard and Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet keyboard! Mouse is simple than most gaming mice I have become accustomed to, but functions adequately. I love the layout and typing experience of the keyboard. The keyboard captures every key press without error other than my mistypes. Battery life is great and doesn't chew through batteries quickly. Only critique I would say is that I wish there was a place to store the wireless dongle. It does make moving around with the keyboard troublesome having to find a separate place to store the dongle. It doesn't diminish the fact that this is a good quality keyboard and mouse that have not failed in many months of use.
customer_reviews.author: D.L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: No More Wires
customer_reviews.text: Love having a clean. minimal desk space? Don't like seeing a jungle of cords on your desk? Then this keyboard is the keyboard for you! I was given a computer for work but didn't want the standard Dell wired keyboard and mouse, so opted into buying a wireless keyboard. Definitely worth the investment! And it's super cheap too, but the quality of the keyboard is there. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Indy Devera

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Working from home due to Covid I wanted a wireless keyboard that felt similar to my company’s office wired keyboard without the wires. This keyboard and mouse combo are the exact same keyboard and mouse that my office uses, just without the wires! Solid build, quality feel to keys and mouse, battery operated with on/off switches, caps lock led indicator, number pad, the list goes on and on! Got this for under $40, really a bargain in this space. Buy it, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: ALWAYS MISSING
customer_reviews.text: I recently started using this same mouse & keyboard at work and love it. I decide to order it for my home office. The first time I ordered it was about 2 weeks ago. I tried to set it up but it was missing the drive that plugs into the computer so I returned it due to missing parts. I reordered the item this past Wednesday, received it on Friday and AGAIN MISSING THE DRIVE THAT PLUGS INTO THE COMPUTER. IM SOOO ANNOYED! PEOPLE GET IT TOGETHER! Not sure if I'm going to order it again for the 3rd time and hope they get it right or just order something else from another company.
customer_reviews.author: RUNANDTELLTHAT

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to go with my Dell Latitude laptop and docking station. This is the wireless version of the mouse and keyboard I was using. I primarily use my computer for MS Office, accounting and web browsing, so I have no special or specific needs. As a basic keyboard, and someone who was just looking to go wireless, it performs just fine and as expected. My only gripe is the keyboard battery only lasts about 4 mos. And goes before the mouse batteries. I decided to get a set of rechargeables so I am not buying batteries frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Hol9798

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. If you are transitioning from a Mac keyboard this is very similar to look and feel. I do experience occasional dupe or skipped characters but I am not convinced it is not just a Windows thing or just response issue. As a Mac lover Windows is just quirky so I cannot blame hardware for issues. I used to be able to text from my Mac/iPhone that Windows will not support. This keyboard has USB switch that let me connect it to my iPhone. So with a flip of a switch I am typing texts direct to my phone. Love that feature.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleL

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse and keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this to switch between 3 different computers - 2 laptops and a desktop. The button on the mouse and the switch on the keyboard make it really easy to switch almost instantaneously between computers without having to move my hands off them. Both laptops have Bluetooth, and the pairing process was painless. The desktop uses the USB connector, which conveniently (and magnetically!) stows inside the mouse for travel. The feel of the mouse and keyboard is great and it's very quiet. I'm typing on it as we speak, and it's much better than the keyboard on my laptops or my old cheap USB keyboard. It's definitely been a good investment for me.
customer_reviews.author: Smytty

customer_reviews.title: Have to re-type
customer_reviews.text: I called the customer service line soon after my purchase, but the issue stopped happening while I was on the phone. Another gal in my office had the same keyboard and mouse, but without a single issue. THE PROBLEM: While typing, not all the letters will show up and there is some kind of delay. It was majorly frustrating and caused me grief when sending emails for work. I came across some embarrassing moments during a peak email day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon1

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard problem
customer_reviews.text: The product looks great. besides the left "Ctrl" key being in the way and accidentally pressed all the time, this set is sleek. Now for the bad, keyboard loses connection to the computer. I would be typing along and half the letters does not make it through. new batteries, rechargeable batteries, nothing helped. I went back to a wired keyboard and mouse and returned the set
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard will work intermittently less than a month after you buy it. Go ahead and swap batteries. It still won't work properly. For a while I thought it was my computer but my computer rescources are too low to be giving me these issues. I've used a wired keyboard and it works fine. This is the second one of these I've used and it's crap. I have the dongle 2 feet in direct sight to the keyboard. I'll be going back to wired because of this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: it's the best wireless set I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the media keys to work, even after troubleshooting the issue. I am using a prehistoric Dell (Windows 7) laptop so it is probably a problem on my end. Otherwise, it's the best wireless set I have owned. I was worried the low-profile would bother me but it actually pretty comfortable and seems less carpal-tunnel-inducing than a traditional keyboard. The low-profile actually makes it easier to store in my backpack too. I usually disable or remove LEDs because they always seem too bright so I like that there is no illumination on it whatsoever (except maybe the low battery indicator, which I haven't seen yet)
customer_reviews.author: EricP

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, reminiscent to the KB212
customer_reviews.text: I was going between this wireless version of the keyboard and the wired version, and I'm glad I went with wireless. I was looking for something like the Dell KB212 keyboard, which has always been my favorite ever since I had a job doing financial transcription. The keys are responsive. They do feel slightly stickier than the KB212, but I don't really mind it. The mouse is good too - I didn't really buy this for the mouse but it's always nice to have a back up mouse in case my first one kicks the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: I have purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this keyboard and mouse. The replacement set has given me issues. The keyboard the will skip or make multiple key strikes. I have replaced the batteries and still having problems. I assumed I would get a good keyboard because I spent quite a bit of money. Also two of the keys have popped off and I have a had a little over a month. I have not issues with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: ConstanceOlivia

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a wireless keyboard/mouse combo. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a PC Tech for a medium sized organization. Wireless keyboard/mouse combos used to be large and noisy. Dell is an expert on ergonomics and this keyboard demonstrates good design. The keyboard doesn't waste extra space and add useless keys like other keyboard/mouse combos. It takes up little space and works well. Hey everyone, keyboards are supposed to make noise when you tap them! It's called tactile feedback. If it made no noise you wouldn't know that you typed. Our staff write thousands of emails, and reams of documentation every year, and I've only replaced two in heavy use environments. For the price these keyboards are a real bargain. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Computer Tech

customer_reviews.title: Replacement keyboard and mouse work fine
customer_reviews.text: I have a Dell computer which had this same keyboard and mouse. They both started acting up and having trouble. It probably was a simple fix or dirt in someplace, but when I saw this on Amazon and the price, I decided to get a new one. It came fast. I put in the USB receiver, put in batteries and they both worked fine. Easier, and maybe cheaper, than fixing the old ones. They have both been working for a while now, much better than what I had.
customer_reviews.author: David Herr

customer_reviews.title: Good quiet keyboard with kids mouse
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement to my noisy keyboard mouse pair, Its quiet and would be a good replacement for my cranky keyboard always getting into my zoom calls. The keyboard is plain and I couldn't figure out what the problem was with the mouse, except that it just didn't fit right in my hands. (I imagine it a personal thing so no points deducted) My daughter grabbed them and she loves them both
customer_reviews.author: Openball

customer_reviews.title: If you want simple but effective, here it is.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very picky when it comes to keyboards as I have large and disfigured fingers but this is not a bad purchase by any means. Very simple and easy. I have a PC hooked up to my TV and use the wireless combo for a cords free environment. Having two dogs demands cords free and this keyboard / mouse deliver well. I really enjoy the flush keyboard face the most. Not a lot of pressure needed per key and the stroke is very short as I hoped. Definitely a good purchase indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Melius

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, Unreliable Mouse On Dark Surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Yay Keyboard, UGH Mouse. I've had two of these and they have had the exact same issue. The mouse refuses to work smoothly on dark granite. I have a $20 logitech wireless mousethat works absolutely perfectly so it is definitely the mouse design or components. Buy it if you have a regular desk or want to use as mouse pad, assuming you want to feel like it's still 1998. Otherwise look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffreyd00

customer_reviews.title: [KM636 V2] Nice and sleek
customer_reviews.text: This is a great combo of 2 wireless devices for a low price. I use the same keyboard and mouse at work, and wanted the same for my personal desktop. I had some connectivity issues in the beginning, but it seemed to act up only when connected to a USB 3.0 port. Switching to USB 2.0 has solved the issue for me. My only complaint is that moving the mouse (when on) is enough to wake up the desktop from sleep mode. Very simplistic design and diminishes cluttering wires.
customer_reviews.author: Jon K.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Why it took me so long to pony up and buy a wireless keyboard/mouse combo, who knows. But I'm glad I did. I was restricted by the USB wires on my old setup that I had to be careful not to pull my keyboard drawer out too far. This has changed everything. I like low profile keys, and this keyboard has been great. The mouse is good too, but it's a mouse. Nothing special about it. Keyboard goes into energy saving mode rather quickly, which is great. At the press of a button it's back on and registering to the PC. No lag, delay or having to double press. I'll be ordering more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Want to have constant issues and replace the batteries every week? If yes, buy this keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: Want to have constant issues and replace the batteries every week? If you answered yes, then you should buy this keyboard!! Batteries die once a week. Constantly has connection issues. Spend the extra few bucks on a Logitech or higher quality keyboard. Not sure how dell can build great computers/products but then let this poorly design/engineered "keyboard" leave their warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Sessa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for about six months, and about three months after I got it, frequently it would not register when I touched a key. I cannot seem to find a pattern or a particular key that it has problems with. Also it does not seem to be related to battery strength. It is a lower-priced keyboard, so I'm chalking it up to being that I get what I paid for. I would not buy this product again. I would spend a little more and get a better quality keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: Ghost Typing Frustrations
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed the look and feel, but the constant ghost typing and delays were unbearable. I was surprised to see this from Dell. Follow Up: After dealing with the frustrations I had with the KM717, I recently ordered the KM636 (V2). Dumb move (no.1), but I was in a pinch and needed something fast. I also figured, what are the odds that both models would be so bad. Right out of the box, I was experiencing delays and ghost typing. I would return, but I also received it on garbage day and tossed all of the packaging (dumb move No. 2). So, I guess my collection of unusable keyboards has grown by one and I'm out $34.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Clel

customer_reviews.title: Susceptable to USB 3.0 RF interference
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was intermittently unresponsive and the mouse wouldn't work from 6 feet away. I modified various Windows 10 settings to no avail. Then I plugged the transceiver into the USB 2.0 port and all the problems went away. It's well documented that USB 3.0 ports/cables can interfere with 2.4GHz devices, but I never experienced it till now. I'm using the Dell Keyboard/mouse with a non-Dell PC, so maybe Dell can claim the devices were designed to work with specific Dell computers.
customer_reviews.author: RHB

customer_reviews.title: OK for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: It's OK for occasional use. Battery life is excellent. The moue is a bit small, but works OK otherwise. The keyboard is horrible. It makes a lot of mistakes, when I type quickly, it will just randomly drop letters. Also, I'm not any sort of keyboard snob, but it is just very hard to type on, the keys are flat and take a lot of pressure to push.
customer_reviews.author: PN

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse and keyboard set because it seemed to be Dell's top model. It is great and love that I can pair it via bluetooth with my tablet and my android phone. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that occasionally one of the devices (usually the mouse) will stop working and I have to turn it off and back on again for it to resume working. That's easy enough to do, but it is kind of annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Andy D.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I had not opened this set until now, because I just assembled my brother's new desktop, and oh, man, it's glitchy. It never completes the words, it loses connection all the time, and the mouse lags a lot. Unfortunately my return window is far gone, since I had the set stored for a few months. Buy a cheaper chinese wireless keyboard/mouse set instead, you'll probably get better quality. I rate Sleep mode with 5 stars because it's all the keyboard does! It goes to sleep mode literally every 4 seconds, changed 2 different pairs of batteries (high end batteries) and it still loses connection and goes to sleep!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Lainez

customer_reviews.title: Quite keys - very noisy body
customer_reviews.text: A big part of the reason why I wanted a chiclet style keyboard was because they are quiet. Super quiet. And this one is no except if you are just talking about the keys. However, the plastic case which houses the keys rattles like a crate full of tambourines going over a rocky road. It is *really* noisy. All of the noise seems to come from one particular place on the keyboard - just to the left of the slider for the channel selection and it is frustrating as heck. My search for the ultimate chiclet keyboard continues.
customer_reviews.author: FireClown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard & Mouse ~ very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Both keyboard and mouse work PERFECTLY! Excellent quality for the price. Just a note, make sure to turn keyboard on (tiny button in the back that is barely noticeable). I made mistake of thinking something was wrong with the keyboard and after being pointed to the switch the keyboard was working perfect!
customer_reviews.author: HeatherMarie83

customer_reviews.title: The quality is in the details +bluetooth and usb receiver
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. I bought a Logitech for half the price and it was a piece of junk. Decided to upgrade and try this one instead and let me tell you..... this combo works and feels like a top performer. The chicken keyboard makes typing a breeze and the mouse with the arch is an excellent combination. Unlike other keyboards, this keyboard is built with quality materials. This is one of the few combinations I found had both, Bluetooth and USB receiver. This is nice because it allows connectivity to computers with no Bluetooth, phones with no USB port or any combination of the 2. I just got it today and I am beyond satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best looking combo but constantly loses connectivity
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard and moupse combo is slighty disappointing due to the fact that the keyboard regularly lost connection. I would have to constantly switch from bluetooth to the receiver and still sometimes that didn't help. There was also some delay in key inputs on many occasions. The combo looks beautiful but it simply doesn't perfom well. I've used cheap keyboards that have no suffered connectivity issues so this one was a let down.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Keyssssssssssss stick
customer_reviews.text: hhhvahasikkkkkbard fffffoooooooooooooooor 22222 years. keys stick. fffffresh batteries temporarily help. Eats through batteries quickly. Very frustrrrrrgg. Translation with Laptop keyboard: I have had this keyboard for 2 years. The keys stick. Fresh batteries temporarily help. Eats through batteries quickly. Very Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was fine but after 4 months, the keyboard struggles to maintain its connection to the receiver, even when in direct line of site of the unifying receiver just 1-2 feet away. I started to notice the issue 2-3 months into use - the signal could not travel through my leg (typing from lap) when 1-2 feet from the receiver. Now, even when there aren't obstructions, about 15% of my key strokes are missed. Typing this review on the KM636 keyboard was so painful...
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Goldwater

customer_reviews.title: Not very reliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in January 2020. I've used it for work everyday. However, the keyboard and mouse have both begun to stop working. Batteries have been changed and still I've had issues with both the mouse and keyboard lagging or just plain not working. I wouldn't recommend this product. I'd return but have thrown out the boxes the came in.
customer_reviews.author: Kimfen

customer_reviews.title: Lousy
customer_reviews.text: Paid $82 and change for this DELL wireless keyboard and mouse and what a disappointment. I can barley type out this review with the skipping and sticking keys. It also EATS batteries especially the key board. Transmitter range is a no more than a foot. I keep a wired keyboard handy if I have important work to do. Not recommended at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rudyguzoodee

customer_reviews.title: The key board was great but no
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard for about 5 months and i have found that the longer i have had it the worse it performs. To explain, when i type the keyboard will randomly not read my last key stroke or read it multiple times. When i first got it, it happend once every 15-20th key stroke so i thought it was maybe me and kept replacing the batteries and turned it off when i was done using it. Now its 5 months later and it wont read my keystrokes every 5-8th time. My office space is clean and i do not eat over my keyboard. Buy another product. This is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Heraty

customer_reviews.title: Bad design avoid this broke do no reason
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Design flaw that the cursor if you drop it will break this flimsy little pressed down Pole, tha makes this mouse totally useless, this makes no sense since this is an $80 keyboard and I wish to God I would’ve seen this before Try to avoid this looks nice and sleek but is just fundamentally bad design
customer_reviews.author: P. Industriales Inc.

customer_reviews.title: I love the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: There is a little bit of delay, almost unnoticeable. if you are a gamer and have been using wired mechanical keyboards all your life, you will feel the difference. I would love to give them 5 starts, but the mouse that came with is just not the best. The mice itself has a great comfortable design. My hands are bigger than average and require a much chunkier mouse. Great product overall
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small problems that can make it useless
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard/mouse twice, and the first set works just great. I like the feel of both keyboard and mouse, and love having no wires. My second set (purchased for my job) has broken after about two months. The keyboard ESC key has simply stopped working. The mouse scroll wheel becomes disabled if it sits for a few seconds, and won't activate until I move the mouse again. I abandoned each piece individually for their different problems.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne L. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dell Optiplex that I use as my media server, and couldn't be happier. As soon as I plugged in the USB receiver, it immediately recognized it and I was able to use the keyboard and mouse within seconds. Best of all, it is sleek and compact and I can store it right next to the server and not worry about messing with bundling and hiding cables.
customer_reviews.author: paulandtoby

customer_reviews.title: ... have no way of knowing if it was any good or not
customer_reviews.text: I have no way of knowing if it was any good or not. It arrived with parts missing to hook it to the computer. I explained the situation to Amazon and they agreed to send a replacement. They did and it was exactly like the first one. I sent them both back for a refund. It appears that Dell has totally gone to the dogs. Up to now they have had good equipment, but no more. The sooner they all get the hell out of china, the better off we'll all be.
customer_reviews.author: bab19

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for work and I have been using it for a couple weeks and I like it. I had to get used to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale for under 15 bucks delivered and it's a steal at that price. Everything else in that price range is a no name brand or one I've never heard of. I bought this for work and I have been using it for a couple weeks and I like it. I had to get used to the short key strokes. The usb dingle is very small and doesn't get in the way at all. I'm sure I'll need another one sooner or later and I hope I can get it at this price.
customer_reviews.author: b mcewen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE WITH MAC.
customer_reviews.text: There is no reason I should be getting mouse cursor lag at all on my system. I am running an i7, 16GB DDR3, SSD, and Intel HD4000. I thought Microsoft could at least do a wireless keyboard and mouse, guess I was wrong. I will save to buy a Magic Mouse 2 and Keyboard from Apple. Higher priced, but so much more reliable, and far premium build. Wow, I'm completely done with Microsoft products.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sproles

customer_reviews.title: It won't work. Electro Spot won't help.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for three months then stopped working unceremoniously. If you buy this product from Dell you get a one year warranty, but somehow if you buy from ELECTRO SPOT you only get a three month warranty. You'll have difficulty reaching them and getting a response from them, too, before they finally tell you that they are keeping your money and you're just screwed. I would only buy this product directly from Dell in the future. I would never buy anything from Electro Spot again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Sands

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I use Dell products for work and they build great products, however, this set of KM636 wireless Keyboard & Mouse has a major design flaw; they are very sensitive to interference. I faced constant lag even when I moved wireless devices from nearby. Half the times I used the set, they would simply stop working, even with new set of batteries. If you look elsewhere online, you'll find mostly negative reviews about the product. I believe the Dell set built by Logitech wireless works better.
customer_reviews.author: bcaesar85

customer_reviews.title: So sntenceeeees looooook like ths. And the mouse must have some kind ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't Buy This The keyboard often either fails to register key presses or repeats a single key press 5-10 times. So sntenceeeees looooook like ths. And the mouse must have some kind of a sleep mode, so when you first move it after having not used it for a few seconds, there's an annoying delay before it responds. I'm using this keyboard to type this review and it's taking about twice as long as it should because I have to go back to either add missing letters or erase duplicated letters. Terrible keyboard/mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mk

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy issues
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard works 99.5% of the key hits, some times keys don't show or key just behave erratically, mouse also works but many missclicks or no clicks at all when hitting the buttons, I would not recommend to get this combo, I am giving it away and replacing it with a gamming wireless combo with far more accuracy... if you are not bothered by 0.5% accuracy issues then you will do okey with this combo... in my case I just can't stand hitting several times the key to get a response from the mouse/keyboard... batteries brand new where also replaced with the same result...
customer_reviews.author: Jou

customer_reviews.title: Sleek but squishy... stay away.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wireless keyboard/mouse combo to try to clean up our desktop a little. I like the look of this one but the performance wasn’t up to par. I recognize it’s not a gaming keyboard but I had issues with keys sticking and couldn’t get used to the feel. I returned this keyboard and have gone back to a mechanical model despite the extra bulk on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mike	Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Mouse and keypad work great BUT.
customer_reviews.text: Mouse and keypad work great BUT......you have to look very closely to find the Universal receiver (USB) that makes them work. You would think it would be included in the small package where you find the batteries but instead it is attached to the cardboard insert in a small flap on the right side of the box! It is very small and easily overlooked!!!! Dell needs to change their packaging on this. If you accidentally throw the receiver away, you may as well throw both the keyboard and mouse out. I've been told be reliable techy folks that each receiver is specifically programmed to the mouse and keyboard in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Benson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard, sub-par mouse
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is awesome. Very good quality, light, and the key response is very nice. Also being able to pair and type with the keyboard via Bluetooth to my iPhone is awesome too. Dont waste your time buying the bundle. Just buy the keyboard itself (WK717). The mouse, although very sleek design, the tracking is mediocre. Because the sensor is located at the front of the mouse instead of the middle. Cursor tends to jump around sometimes. Not smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Peppino

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard mouse combo. It is great because my laptop only has two USB ports and this way I only need one for both keyboard and mouse. Love that its wireless too. I was concerned that I would be frequently changing batteries but I have been using these for 11 hour workdays 5 days a week with no battery change needed so far in two and a half months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but beware of distance from keyboard to dongle!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with windows 10 setup. I initially had the same issue many other reviewers had reported... jerky movement with the mouse, and missing letters while typing followed by repeated letters... one keystroke of "g" would display diddly, then "ggggggg" after a delay. However, this problem was easily corrected by moving the dongle from the usb port on the far side of my laptop to the near side... and voila, worked perfectly. The "workable" distance is short, in my opinion... mouse to dongle distance of > 24" created problems; within 12" and my problems disappeared. Other than the above "feature" I think the build quality and usability are excellent for this $20 product.
customer_reviews.author: GFG1200

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. Looks great. Exactly as expected. The keys are properly spaced apart. I have zero complaints about this set. I have however been experiencing some repeats, but i'm thinking it may be my fault (??), or the archaic PC i am using it with. Will update. Update: Yes this keyboard is prone to random repeats. As in 10 consecutive letters. I just returned to process a return; but i may be one day too late. Tax day kept me busy.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Jean-Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these which I badly regret and missed the return window for the unopened one. Had it for about 2 months now and the keys on keyboard are extremely spotty. Very slow or no response key time. The mouse has a heavy lag. This keyboard has a fixed height. You can not adjust the height like most keyboards with flip leg, which this doesn't have. I've owned many wireless keyboard/mouse and Dell products but this has been far the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pak

customer_reviews.title: Letters Do Not Always Register on the Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I do not care for this keyboard. It's beyond the 30 days, so I cannot return it, but I am on the hunt for a better one. I am a great typist, but with this keyboard I found that I am constantly tapping the backspace key due to the fact that I have constant spelling errors. If you are a slow typist, this keyboard will probably meet your needs. However, for those who type fast, you'll find that you really have to press each key for the letter/# to register. It's completely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Christane

customer_reviews.title: Flaky keyboard; Good Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, my mouse works fine, but the keyboard is flaky. Half the time I find myself typing harder than usual to try and make sure that all of the letters are actually getting on the screen. I have the USB dongle plugged in near the front of the computer - there is less than 12" between them, but I still get lots of missed letters and that is frustrating. I like the feel of the keyboard and the mouse works great and the elimination of the wires has been heaven, but the flakiness of the keyboard is extremely aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Ed G.

customer_reviews.title: Dell Hit a Home Run with this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this combo keyboard and mouse a few days ago and had it set up within 15 minutes after opening the package. It's now been a few days of constant service and I LOVE this keyboard. Responsive, fast, highly accurate and the technology is top-drawer! What I really like is that this keyboard can double as a keyboard for our Android TV, so I get multiple uses out of the same piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Nah
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of use this keyboard warped in the middle. Not visually noticeable but every time you type, the whole thing vibrates and it's very annoying. If you are a fast typer you will surely not be able to use it. Even for hunt n pecking you feel it with every key stroke. I wish this would have happened before our return-by date.
customer_reviews.author: T Green

customer_reviews.title: Best desktop keyboard I've found!
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of the KM717 package. The keyboard is awesome. It is sleek and slim. The keys are a pleasure to press. The construction is high quality. It's also cool that both bluetooth and USB are supported. The same cannot be said of the mouse, however- it very uncomfortable to use. Overall highly recommend, but for the keyboard only.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.Mesrop.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking keyboard/mouse, but laggy
customer_reviews.text: Overall nice product. Look and felt as advertised. My one complaint (and the deal breaker) is that the mouse and keyboard would lag. After further investigating the product and problem, I learned this is a common complaint for the KM717. My desktop tower is under the desk and the lag could be due to the fact that my keyboard and mouse are "too far" away from the tower. I'm not moving my desktop tower and I'm not typing with the keyboard on my lap so I returned the product. I cannot have keyboard where I worry that a letter that I typed didn't get recorded.
customer_reviews.author: stalwart105

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for the money
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I had an occasional problem with the keys not bottoming out and letters would be missing. I could live with that, but the scroll wheel on the mouse was so sensitive that the slightest pressure on it would put it into the automatic scroll mode and suddenly I had "runaway scrolling". That may have been a defect with that particular mouse, since I have not seen it mentioned elsewhere here. For the money, this is not a bad wireless combination.
customer_reviews.author: Norcal Rob

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought the keyboard an mouse for my extra desktop sitting in the room. Do not use the computer so often, probably 2-3 times a week and max for one-hour per sitting. The Keyboard and the mouse stopped working after one month of use. Replaced a new set of batteries but it's not working well. If you click the mouse and type on the keyboard it doesn't do the click and you have to press very hard on the mouse and keyboard to get the job done. Very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Abdul Baker Chowdhury

customer_reviews.title: *  dead  *
customer_reviews.text: Well, that lasted from 17th February, 2019 until today 3 June, 2019. Neither the keyboard nor the mouse work. I have tried using different USB plugs on my computer, new batteries...everything but an exorcism (that's next). I contacted Dell's support chat and was told that I was in the wrong place. The URL he/she sent me to was also incorrect so I gave up. I don't have time for third world customer service reps sending me on wild goose chases.
customer_reviews.author: TGSinCiceroNY

customer_reviews.title: Just write (get it?)
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through 4 keyboards and hit the jackpot with this one. The ergonomics (for me) is perfect. The ultra thin keyboards did not have enough "give" so I'm hitting the wrong buttons. The old school keyboards were too much and loud. Easy plug and play with my HP laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal in PRB

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three months of normal use...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in September, brand new. The "e" button stopped functioning properly in November and I can't return it because it's too late? What kind of keyboard lasts three measly months before breaking? Had to use a different keyboard to even type this.
customer_reviews.author: diomedes

customer_reviews.title: Does not support MacOS properly
customer_reviews.text: Seems okay enough. It doesn't advertise Mac support, so it's really my fault, but scroll wheel on the Mac only registers when spun at high speeds. Not very effective for when you need to scroll carefully (ie zooming on google maps). Overall the keyboard is nice and quiet, but the keys are a little close together. You can kind of feel that it's a cheaply made product with the materials, but good value for the money if you only need it for Windows.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainTaihu

customer_reviews.title: Lag, missed key strokes, duplicate keystrokes, you name it. Stick w/Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Totally unusable. After years of owning Logitech wireless keyboards and mice, I switched to a Dell KB216 keyboard (wired). I loved the basic layout and low-profile chiclet keys. The KM636 was a wireless version of that setup. The mouse was fine, but the keyboard was terrible. Lag, missed key strokes, duplicate keystrokes, you name it. Tried new batteries, placement of the mini-dongle, nothing. Switched back to my old keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket 455

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my desk at work
customer_reviews.text: I for a while used the wired variant of this keyboard and mouse and love it because of how slim and quiet it is. Not to mention the dedicated volume keys. The only issue i have is that you can’t pretty both Control and Space at the same time otherwise nothing will register i noticed this while i was testing minecraft. Pros: •Quiet • Slim • Great Battery Life • Dedicated Volume controls • Made by Logitech Cons: •Weird key-rollover issues • only has one angle of adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Peter F

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: My work purchased this combo for the office. I fell in love with this keyboard and had to buy one for home. I can type faster on this keyboard than any other on the market. The buttons are perfectly spaced for my typing style. Battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: IronFelix717

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works well, as described. Sturdy. Keyboard does not take up much room on the desk. Mouse is a little oddly shaped but that's ok. Need to turn on the mouse every time I us...has an auto "turn off" by default if you don't use it for a couple of hours or so....which is probably a good thing. Annoying sometimes but you get used to it. Good product all around.
customer_reviews.author: Geo42

customer_reviews.title: mouse works fine but keyboard gets about every other letter you
customer_reviews.text: bought 8 of these for my office. threw all 8 away and went to staples for logitech. mouse works fine but keyboard gets about every other letter you type
customer_reviews.author: darren maines

customer_reviews.title: Q A Z and spacebar has issues on this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am really unhappy about this keyboard. If you Google Dell wireless keyboards you'll notice that the issue with the q a z and spacebar key constantly stops working. I am past the return window so sad I cannot return it and had to buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price -- Quality Construction and Ergonomical
customer_reviews.text: For the price, great wireless keyboard/mouse combo. I can certainly tell that it's not a $100 keyboard, but it's well constructed, the battery life is great, and I like the chicklet keys. I have the similar, more expensive, wired set at my office, and use this one at my home office. Great not to have wires, and works like a charm, and only about $20... what else can you ask for. I just bought a second one for a colleague.
customer_reviews.author: The Tenneys

customer_reviews.title: Simple, sturdy keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This purchase replaced the same style, model DELL keyboard I have had for a long time. I have several computers with keyboards but this is the one I like best. Nothing fancy just a simple keyboard without "bells and whistles" . Didn't need the mouse, but it came along with purchase. NGK
customer_reviews.author: NGK

customer_reviews.title: No more loud clicks
customer_reviews.text: I have the corded version of this keyboard in my office at work. We recently switched to this keyboard from the older, louder keyboards. I work next to two other individuals and it got to be very distracting. I purchased the wireless version for home because I liked my work keyboard so much. I also love the easy scrolling with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Kandyce D.

customer_reviews.title: Tuned to frequency?? - Dell needs to retune some board members to recover exchange costs :) Looks sweet though.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice to match any Dell Slimline Desktop but beware , the single USB connector is tuned specifically to match this mouse with this specific keyboard. I don't mean model , I mean specific, only , no other. Plus in Dells weak effort to save a nickel and lose a dollar the frequency matching can catch interference and accidentally become untuned. Then you have nothing. Definitely a not thought about attempt to replace half of these is in full swing , save your receipt and then save the next one! When it's right its a dandy but when it's not it's less than a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Von Dandy

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Product works just fine, but the battery life is terrible. I have replaced the batteries 6 times on the keyboard and 3 times on the mouse since purchase. The look and feel of the product holds up to the expectation, but I cannot get over the poor battery life. I only use this for a typical M-F 40hr work week.
customer_reviews.author: dta0485

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard if you are looking for something similar to the Mac keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Really great keyboard and mouse. The keyboard is very smooth and soft. It has the feel of a Mac keyboard which is exactly what I was looking for. The mouse has an interesting curve which I like and it has a button on the side you can press and it will direct you to the previous page you were at. Batteries are included. The only thing is that when it arrived to my house, and I opened the box it was all misplaced. The batteries were just everywhere! That's the only thing.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Wireless is the Max.-
customer_reviews.text: Very nice keyboard & mouse combo set. Have connected a 10" Notebook via HDMI cable to a standard 29" TV set, now can surf any stuff on line, check, answer emails, write text, see Netflix, You Tube, photos, videos whatever controlled by wireless keyboard & mouse that seats on a breakfast tray located front of me. There are some signs that when viewed on screen does not match the ones typed on the keyboard, keyboard probably needs some key configuration. Will contact Dell to check out that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Searider

product_meta.title: Dell KM636 Wireless Keyboard & Mouse Combo (5WH32), Black
product_meta.description: Style:KM636 (V2)Dell KM636 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo.
feature_bullets: Designed for: Inspiron 11 3179, 32XX, 3459, 3668; latitude 12 5289, 13 7350, 7370, E5270, E5460, E5470, E5570, E7270, E7470; Optiplex 30XX, 3240, 50XX, 5250, 70XX, 7440; Precision mobile workstation 3510, 55XX, 7510, 7710; Precision tower 3420, 3620, 5810; Vostro 15 35XX, 32XX, 3668; Dell wyse 30XX, 50XX, 7010. Long, efficient battery life
Elevated and spacious chiclet keys, multimedia keys, plus optical tracking for precise mouse movement

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars7,505 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
